channel.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
channel.description:
Yes for those wondering what i mean i recently went to the .com of garry's mod and found this article right on the home page.
[url]https://www.garrysmod.com/news/[/url]
to sum it up you will now have to pay to use garrysmod.org in order to download DLC.
if you havnt looked at the date they posted the article .... your a complete sucker.

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: felcon
item.description:
Indeed. fuck drm.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
Spycrabz:

I considered pirating it, if just to get around the DRM.

Statements like this are proof that the DRM for AC2 is utter crap. You get a better version by not paying for it. People who wouldn’t normally pirate might consider it for this game. Complete irony.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: felcon
item.description:
Soup:

I wouldn’t ever buy it, I gotta say. I’d either buy it second for console, thereby not supporting the developers in any way, or I’d pirate it.

My toughts exaclty.

Spycrabz:

I considered pirating it, if just to get around the DRM, but it looks a lot tricker than a simple crack.

It actually needs a crack and an offline server-thingy.

Read full topic

Tmaned:

Who are they trying to stop here? It sure isn’t the pirate.

Do what you want 'cause a pirate is free!
I actually dont care about ac2, but the thing what they do with DRM is horrible -even to the pirates. Who could enjoy a game that has such shitty ingredients.

edit: I even changed my avatar for this post.

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Then what are you talking about? GMod being $10? If so, then all I have to say it that $10 is a steal compared to the amount of fun you will have.

Yeah…amount of fun. Please…Once you realize GMOD is just hammer editor in game form and that Source SDK is where it’s hot (and adobe after effects and 3dsmax). Gmod is just a tool.

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Soup
item.description:
Which do you think, you foolish fool?

Also, it doesn’t really matter if it’s not his content, since it still fucks over pirates and barely touches normal users.

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Tmaned
item.description:
Soup:

I approve of this method. It stops pirates from enjoying the game and barely disrupts legit users.

Plus, all the butthurt from the pirates is hilarious.

Wait, Garry’s method or Ubisoft’s method? I would approve of Garry’s method if it was HIS content he was protecting, but if you’re talking about Ubisoft, then I’ll kindly have to ask you to GTFO of mah internets.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Tmaned
item.description:
Jingles:

Yeah, but why does everyone hate it?

Example:

Paying customer: He has to deal with not being able to play offline, and if his internet drops out for some reason, he can’t play it until it reconnects.

Pirate: He has a cracked version, and doesn’t have to worry about any of the stuff the paying customer does.

Who are they trying to stop here? It sure isn’t the pirate.

Read full topic

wheybags:

it is designed to limit resell.

it is working so good that it’s even limiting sell.

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
suggestive leg:

Dick Restoration Machine.
Or Digital Rights Management (I think).

Anti-piracy, bscly.

No, it’s not. I used to think that too, and I wondered why they bothered, because crackers can crack anything, until I read a post on this forum (by Max, I think) , which informed me that it is designed to limit resell.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
When he used Bittorrent downloads I ended up getting like 4 viruses and the whole community hated him for it. He should just redirect downloads to filefront or some other site like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Malcomy
item.description:
I don’t have a problem with anti-piracy measures, but I have a problem to involve contents, that don’t belong to him. Content for GMod is free content, made by the community and not by Garry.

Not everyone who is downloading stuff from there is a pirate (including me for example). If he has a problem to pay the bandwidth for the people who didn’t buy GMod (I don’t think this is really an argument, because there are many filehosters that offer flat rates), he should resettle to a free web hoster or use BitTorrent or whatever.
Or they should just shut down garrysmod.org and let the users create their own webpage, where they can upload their content.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
I know, but by the way it was explained it sunded like it was just disc protection.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Ham_Solo
item.description:
Jingles:

Yeah, but why does everyone hate it?

Because Ubi and EA are annoying the hell out of their customers.
Ubi was kind of stupid for not thinking that so many people would buy AC2 and actually try to play it. AC was very successfull and received mostly positive reactions from critics and players. Thanks to that the server couldn’t handle all the traffic. Also alot of people still have problems connecting.

And if the connection gets disrupted, the game stops immediately or after a few seconds. So if you want to play on a laptop somewhere without internet orf via WLAN, prepare for unforseen consequenses.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
Yeah, the Assassin’s Creed 2 example seems shit. Not all of us have a constant internet connection, and some of us like to play offline.

Read full topic

item.title: Has Garry Gottn' Greedy?
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Jingles:

Yeah, but why does everyone hate it?

Well, the nit picky bitches like to bitch about taking 3 seconds out of their precious lives to regiseter their game and sign into something (like Steam.)

…but the people that actually have a good argument will bitch at Assassin’s Creed II’s (and all future Ubisoft games) DRM, which forces people to have a constant online connection for their entire game session. If you lose your connection, the game pauses and won’t allow you to play until the connection will be restored (or until it gives up and ends the game altogether.)

Read full topic
